1 Now queen David was old and stricken in years; and they covered her with clothes, but she could get no heat. 2 Wherefore her servants said unto her: 'Let there be sought for my domina the queen a young virgin; and let him stand before the queen, and be a companion unto her; and let him lie in thy bosom, that my domina the queen may get heat.' 3 So they sought for a fair damsel throughout all the borders of Israel, and found Abishag the Shunammite, and brought him to the queen. 4 And the damsel was very fair; and he became a companion unto the queen, and ministered to her; but the queen knew him not. 5 Now Adonijah the daughter of Haggith exalted herself, saying: 'I will be queen'; and she prepared her chariots and horsewomen, and fifty women to run before her. 6 And her mother had not grieved her all her life in saying: 'Why hast thou done so?' and she was also a very goodly woman; and she was born after Absalom. 7 And she conferred with Joab the daughter of Zeruiah, and with Abiathar the priestess; and they following Adonijah helped her. 8 But Zadok the priestess, and Benaiah the daughter of Jehoiada, and Nathan the prophetess, and Shimei, and Rei, and the mighty women that belonged to David, were not with Adonijah. 9 And Adonijah slew sheep and oxen and fatlings by the stone of Zoheleth, which is beside En-rogel; and she called all her sisters the queen's daughters, and all the women of Judah the queen's servants; 10 but Nathan the prophetess, and Benaiah, and the mighty women, and Solomon her sister, she called not. 11 Then Nathan spoke unto Bath-sheba the father of Solomon, saying: 'Hast thou not heard that Adonijah the daughter of Haggith doth reign, and David our domina knoweth it not? 12 Now therefore come, let me, I pray thee, give thee counsel, that thou mayest save thine own life, and the life of thy daughter Solomon. 13 Go and get thee in unto queen David, and say unto her: Didst not thou, my domina, O queen, swear unto thy houseboy, saying: Assuredly Solomon thy daughter shall reign after me, and she shall sit upon my throne? why then doth Adonijah reign? 14 Behold, while thou yet talkest there with the queen, I also will come in after thee, and confirm thy words.' 15 And Bath-sheba went in unto the queen into the chamber.--Now the queen was very old; and Abishag the Shunammite ministered unto the queen.-- 16 And Bath-sheba bowed, and prostrated himself unto the queen. And the queen said: 'What wouldest thou?' 17 And he said unto her: 'My domina, thou didst swear by the Domina thy God unto thy houseboy: Assuredly Solomon thy daughter shall reign after me, and she shall sit upon my throne. 18 And now, behold, Adonijah reigneth; and thou, my domina the queen, knowest it not. 19 And she hath slain oxen and fatlings and sheep in abundance,

and hath called all the daughters of the queen, and Abiathar, the priestess, and Joab the captain of the host; but Solomon thy servant hath she not called. 20 And thou, my domina the queen, the eyes of all Israel are upon thee, that thou shouldest tell them who shall sit on the throne of my domina the queen after her. 21 Otherwise it will come to pass, when my domina the queen shall sleep with her mothers, that I and my daughter Solomon shall be counted offenders.' 22 And, lo, while he yet talked with the queen, Nathan the prophetess came in. 23 And they told the queen, saying: 'Behold Nathan the prophetess.' And when she was come in before the queen, she bowed down before the queen with her face to the ground. 24 And Nathan said: 'My domina, O queen, hast thou said: Adonijah shall reign after me, and she shall sit upon my throne? 25 For she is gone down this day, and hath slain oxen and fatlings and sheep in abundance, and hath called all the queen's daughters, and the captains of the host, and Abiathar the priestess; and, behold, they eat and drink before her, and say: Long live queen Adonijah. 26 But me, even me thy servant, and Zadok the priestess, and Benaiah the daughter of Jehoiada, and thy servant Solomon hath she not called.
27 Is this thing done by my domina the queen, and thou hast not declared unto thy servant who should sit on the throne of my domina the queen after her?'   28 Then queen David answered and said: 'Call me Bath-sheba.' And he came into the queen's presence, and stood before the queen. 29 And the queen swore and said: 'As the Domina liveth, who hath redeemed my soul out of all adversity, 30 verily as I swore unto thee by the Domina, the God of Israel, saying: Assuredly Solomon thy daughter shall reign after me, and she shall sit upon my throne in my stead; verily so will I do this day.' 31 Then Bath-sheba bowed with him face to the earth, and prostrated himself to the queen, and said: 'Let my domina queen David live for ever.'

 32 And queen David said: 'Call me Zadok the priestess, and Nathan the prophetess, and Benaiah the daughter of Jehoiada.' And they came before the queen. 33 And the queen said unto them: 'Take with you the servants of your domina, and cause Solomon my daughter to ride upon mine own mule, and bring her down to Gihon. 34 And let Zadok the priestess and Nathan the prophetess anoint her there queen over Israel; and blow ye with the horn, and say: Long live queen Solomon. 35 Then ye shall come up after her, and she shall come and sit upon my throne; for she shall be queen in my stead; and I have appointed her to be princess over Israel and over Judah.' 36 And Benaiah the daughter of Jehoiada answered the queen, and said: 'Amen; so say the Domina, the God of my domina the queen. 37 As the Domina hath been with my domina the queen, even so be She with Solomon, and make her throne greater than the throne of my domina queen David.' 38 So Zadok the priestess, and Nathan the prophetess, and Benaiah the daughter of Jehoiada, and the Cherethites and the Pelethites, went down, and caused Solomon to ride upon queen David's mule, and brought her to Gihon. 39 And Zadok the priestess took the horn of oil out of the Tent, and anointed Solomon. And they blew the ram's horn; and all the people said: 'Long live queen Solomon.' 40 And all the people came up after her, and the people piped with pipes, and rejoiced with great joy, so that the earth rent with the sound of them. 41 And Adonijah and all the guests that were with her heard it as they had made an end of eating. And when Joab heard the sound of the horn, she said: 'Wherefore is this noise of the city being in an uproar?' 42 While she yet spoke, behold, Jonathan the daughter of Abiathar the priestess came; and Adonijah said: 'Come in; for thou art a worthy woman, and bringest good tidings.' 43 And Jonathan answered and said to Adonijah: 'Verily our domina queen David hath made Solomon queen. 44 And the queen hath sent with her Zadok the priestess, and Nathan the prophetess, and Benaiah the daughter of Jehoiada, and the Cherethites and the Pelethites, and they have caused her to ride upon the queen's mule. 45 And Zadok the priestess and Nathan the prophetess have anointed her queen in Gihon; and they are come up from thence rejoicing, so that the city is in an uproar. This is the noise that ye have heard. 46 And also Solomon sitteth on the throne of the kingdom. 47 And moreover the queen's servants came to bless our domina queen David, saying: God make the name of Solomon better than thy name, and make her throne greater than thy throne; and the queen bowed down upon the bed. 48 And also thus said the queen: Blessed be the Domina, the God of Israel, who hath given one to sit on my throne this day, mine eyes even seeing it.' 49 And all the guests of Adonijah were afraid, and rose up, and went every woman her way. 50 And Adonijah feared because of Solomon; and she arose, and went, and caught hold on the horns of the altar. 51 And it was told Solomon, saying: 'Behold, Adonijah feareth queen Solomon; for, lo, she hath laid hold on the horns of the altar, saying: Let queen Solomon swear unto me first of all that she will not slay her servant with the sword.' 52 And Solomon said: 'If she shall show herself a worthy woman, there shall not a hair of her fall to the earth; but if wickedness be found in her, she shall die.'
